stories.text:
I was digging through my closet and found an ipad that was given to me years ago that's great shape, barely used.

iOS is running 9.3.5 but I'm finding it completely unusable. There are no apps on it other than stock.

For example, I want to download an app to use: `This version of iOS is unsupported`...ok, I'll just go to the website.

OAuth won't work with google on safari because `Couldn't sign you in, this browser or app may not be secure`

OK, let's update iOS...nope, can't be done

I've used a mac every day for the past 15 years but have almost never used an iPad, am I a luddite or is Apple really doing their darndest to get me to buy a new iPad?

How is this acceptable?
